intro: Ternstroemia britteniana, commonly known as the Britten's terebinth, is a rare evergreen shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Theaceae, which includes camellias and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and produces small, fragrant white flowers. It is typically found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
